001 package de.pali.transliteration;

007 import de.general.transliteration.ITransliterator;
008 
009 public class PaliHarvardKyotoToDevanagari implements ITransliterator {

108     ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
109     // Methods
110     ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
111 
112     @Override
113     public String fromSchema()
114     {
115         return "HKC";
116     }
117 
118     @Override
119     public String toSchema()
120     {
121         return "DEV";
122     }
123 
124     @Override
125     public String transliterate(String text)
126     {
127         StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder();
128         // chunk the text
129         String[] chunks = chunk(text);
130         for (int i = 0; i < chunks.length; i++) {
131             // get current chunk
132             String c = chunks[i];
133             // split into consonant and vowel
134             String[] parts = c.split("%");
135             String consonant = parts[0];
136             String vowel = parts[1];
137             // if vowel only
138             if (consonant.isEmpty()) {
139                 // use independent vowel symbol
140                 sb.append(map.get("#"+vowel));
141             } else {
142                 // map consonant
143                 sb.append(map.get(consonant));
144                 // if vowel is not a
145                 if (!isInherentVowel(vowel)) {
146                     // add dependent vowel symbol
147                     sb.append(map.get(vowel));
148                 }
149             }
150         }
151         return sb.toString();
152     }   
153     
154     /**
155      * Checks whether the given vowel corresponds to the
156      * inherent devanagari vowel (which is often transliterated as "a")
157      * @param letter letter to check
158      * @return whether given letter is inherent vowel
159      */
160     private boolean isInherentVowel(String letter) {
161         return letter.equals("a");
162     }
163     
164     /**
165      * Chunks a text into chunks consisting of
166      * optionally one or more consonants followed by one vowel
167      * @param text
168      * @return
169      */
170     private String[] chunk(String text) {
171         List<String> out = new ArrayList<String>();
172         String[] a = text.split("");
173         for (int i = 1; i < a.length-1; i++) {
174             StringBuilder chunker = new StringBuilder();
175             while (isConsonant(a[i])) {
176                 chunker.append(a[i]);
177                 i++;
178             }
179             chunker.append("%"+a[i]);
180             out.add(chunker.toString());
181         }
182         return out.toArray(new String[1]);
183     }
184     
185     
186     private boolean isConsonant(String letter) {
187         return letter.matches("[^iueoaIUEOA]+");
188     }
189     
190     private void test (String word) {
191         System.out.println(transliterate(word));
192     }
193     
194     public static void main(String[] args) {
195         new PaliHarvardKyotoToDevanagari().test("ahA");
196     }
197 }
